features: Introducing Copilot on Windows 11, your everyday AI companion - Copilot empowers you to create faster, complete tasks with ease and lessens your cognitive load - making one complicated task, simple.
Immersive 13" touchscreen – Adapts to your surroundings, adjusting the color balance to best suit your environment.
Hinges on your every move – Adjust the angle with built-in Kickstand, adding Surface Pro Signature Keyboard[1] for instant laptop productivity.
Like pen on paper, only better – Take notes more easily in your own handwriting. Sketch ideas and diagrams. It’s all natural with Surface Pro 9 and Surface Slim Pen 2[1].
The perfect angle for video calls – Surface Pro 9 1080p HD camera features an updated angle that places you squarely in the frame.

Open your eyes to remarkable picture quality with Dolby Vision IQ [2] – With stunning visuals comes a stronger connection to the characters and worlds crafted by filmmakers, game designers, and creatives for you to enjoy.

The most powerful Pro does it all – Surface Pro 9 is built on the Intel Evo platform[3], with Intel Core processors, delivering blazing-fast Pro performance. Power through local games, creative apps, or stay on top of work with professional software.
Battery that keeps going and going – Up to 19 hours of battery life[4] means fewer stops to charge along the way.

More of your phone from your PC – Link your Surface Pro to your iPhone[5] or Android device With Microsoft Phone Link [6,7,8]. Make and take calls. Reply to texts. Check and dismiss notifications. Do it all without taking your phone out of your pocket and from your PC[9].
Turn on Dynamic Refresh Rate up to 120Hz – For smoother scrolling and fluid on-screen writing.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Touch, type, ink. Designed for versatility. Slim and sleek Surface Pro 9 design with a stunning, virtually edge-to-edge 13 ̎ PixelSense display built for touch and pen[1].

Immersive 13" touchscreen Surface Pro 9 adapts to your surroundings, adjusting the color balance to best suit your environment. Move seamlessly from Windows 11 tablet Add the Surface Pro Signature Keyboard[1] for instant laptop productivity. The perfect angle for video calls Surface Pro 9 1080p HD camera features an updated angle that places you squarely in the frame.

Like pen on paper, only better Take notes more easily in your own handwriting. Sketch ideas and diagrams. It’s all natural with Surface Pro 9 and Surface Slim Pen 2[1]. If you can type it, you can write it With Ink Anywhere in Windows 11 and Surface Slim Pen 2[1] your handwriting can instantly turn into text in apps and search bars. Our most intuitive pen With the built-in haptic motor in Slim Pen 2, you can feel tactile signals that feels like pen on paper[1].

More of your phone from your PC Link your Surface Pro to your iPhone[5] or Android device With Microsoft Phone Link.[6,7,8] Laptop-level performance you need Surface Pro 9 is built on the Intel Evo platform[3], with Intel Core processors, delivering blazing-fast Pro performance to power through games, apps, or work. Battery that keeps going and going Up to 19 hours of battery life[4] means fewer stops to charge along the way. Built to keep you productive Two USB-C ports let you easily use or charge accessories, dock to high-powered displays, or transfer large creative files with ease.

Even more experiences enhanced by AI Experience the best of Microsoft with AI-enhanced experiences on Surface Pro 9 that make you more productive and your connections more meaningful. More of what you need, when you need it With Windows 11, search, and find answers quickly right from the Windows taskbar. And AI-powered recommendations can recommend relevant files to you in the moment you need them. Design like a Pro Get prompted with design ideas that use AI to help format and even add motion to your content as you continue to drop in your ideas, photos, and text to create the ultimate PowerPoint.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars When portability and ease of use matter more than cost.
reviews.reviewText: I have been only impressed by this pc. When I first bought this I waffled back and forth on whether I should return this and just get Asus' Flow Z13 (same form factor but thicker and similar price but with a dGPU for gaming). I have never had a day where I wished I bought the other. I would consider myself a power user for this product.1. My work "station" consists of this Surface Pro 9, a portable 15.6 in 1080p 165hz gaming monitor that is vertical, an ultrawide 38in 1440p 180hz monitor, a wireless keyboard, and a wireless mouse. All of this is plugged into the surface dock 2 which uses the surface connector. For those that don't know, traditionally it is very hard for any computers to run multiple displays extended, some older CPU's/GPU's won't run or have trouble running 2 displays with different size, resolution, and refresh rates. This little laptop is running 3 high refresh rate monitors whose stats are all different in every way and I've never had display issues aside from me partially plugging in the surface connector (which is user error on my part.)2. In addition to my wonky display setup, the software suite that I run all day is fairly heavy. I have Edge open with 5 tabs, Chrome open with 30+ tabs, Outlook (which is a deplorable and hateful app to use), Excel, File Explorer, and Adobe Acrobat DC. I've never noticed slowdowns, hitches, or weird behaviors DESPITE my abuse of this little tonka truck of a pc. Do note that my model has 32gb of RAM and I knew that I would need the 32gb. As of right now I am writing this review while ALL of my work things are open and my RAM usage is at 51%. Sometimes I will even stream Youtube or Spotify in the background while working with headphones plugged in or through bluetooth. It's pretty wild to see how far the Surface Pro line has really come in the last decade.3. Also, everyone says this and it is true, the screen is gorgeous! Bright, vivid, snappy and I LOVE this aspect ratio!. It's a blast to work on and the touchscreen functionality feels great. I did give Mircosoft my left kidney for this as in addition to the SP9 and SurfDock 2, I also bought the Surface Pen Slim and the SP9 keyboard. It's a lot of extra money but ease of use and function for work was my priority. Not to infrequently I have to sign things digitally or need a customer so sign a doc for me digitally. With Acrobat DC and the surface pen its almost too easy. I've gotten rid of my printer/scanner. Doing this for any important docs is great! The keyboard has storage slot for the slim pen that also wirelessly charges the slim pen while it is sitting in there. Pen is always charged and handy, doesn't fall out like the Asus Flow Z13's pen (and like other comp too) and it just works! setup was automatic and fast, another facet to this product that I've had no issues with and only joy using!4. I even love using this for photo editing in Adobe Lightroom. Now LR has offloaded a lot of their rendering to the cloud so you don't need the beefiest GPU anymore, it would help a little but the experience of editing on this compared to my 6-year-old tower with a GTX 1080 in it has been a noticeable upgrade just because of the CPU being so much better and having so many more cores. So I've even been pleasantly surprised with photo editing on this. being able to unplug and do the editing from couch with my Surface Pen made me enjoy photo editing for the first time in over a decade. I could do this while sitting next to my wife and kids and they got to be a part of the editing process by giving feedback since I could sit WITH them instead of in a separate room alone! So this pc is a win for my family.5. Its portability makes this great for being my office and my home work computer. 1 pc at 2 locations that is so light I forget it's in my bag sometimes! Light and thin but the screen is still 14 in so it is easy enough to work from. Sure the kickstand hurts like hell on your legs for any amount of time more than 2 minutes but I didn't buy a LAPtop I bought a Windows TABLET as almost all of my work requires me to work at a desk. However the kickstand is one of the sturdiest and nicest ones that I've used. Complete confidence in it and it can really let the SP9 get low to the table effectively turning it into a drawing tablet. One other thing to note that isn't advertised the best, SSD is accessible by opening the kickstand and with just pushing against a levered/magnetic cover on the back of the SP9. the SSD is held in with a single philips screw and removing or replacing the drive doesn't seem to void the warranty which is awesome. For those that know Outlook is a destroyer of any kind of hard drive so that was a HUGE plus for me.6. Despite the cost being high for the hardware that has gone into this device, it has effectively saved me money from having to buy another PC for just at home. Plus, when paired with a dock, it really is like having 2 computers, and that is the price premium you are paying for should you buy this.7. Battery life is the best that I have yet experienced out of a Windows laptop so far. When I am using it to watch YouTube in the evening I average 6-7 hours of use with the backlit keyboard plugged and on. It has great battery health settings for those who will use it docked.Some sobering negatives:1. not very 'lapable' due to the kickstand but can be done with the willpower of David Goggins and the thighs of a Greek god2. Cost, it is high just from the viewpoint of the hardware you get at this price.3. Only comes with charger, no other accessories are included. This can greatly add to the cost especially since the current generation of accessories are the priciest they've been. However, I do feel that they are the best quality accessories yet, if you stick with the Mircosoft brand of stuff. It really does add to the convenience and plug-and-play nature of it all.Conclusion: An awesome, light, snappy, powerful experience that when viewed as a way to save time, is worth the cost. Brilliant screen and first-party accessories. Battery is more than good enough, especially when compared to other Windows PCs. I highly recommend this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Just got it, so too early to determine battery life and many of its other functions. But this is my third Surface Pro (had original, Surface Pro 6, and now this Surface Pro 9. So I am obviously very happy with this Microsoft line of products.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars All around excellent computer, fast, well built, stable.
reviews.reviewText: My wife had a Surface Pro 3 from 2014 which was still working well, but could not be upgraded any more and will not be supported much longer. I bought this Surface Pro 9 as a gift, and it is solid, fast, and great to use.Configuration is Core i7 256gb SSD 16gb RAM. This much RAM is the sweet spot using Windows 11, and this computer is MUCH faster than her old surface.I did not buy the pen because she never used it with her old computer, but I did buy the Signature keyboard (bought from Microsoft since Amazon didn't have it in the matching color) because it definitely is solid and types well. But those who really type strongly might prefer to use a Bluetooth keyboard and mouse from Logitech like the MK270, which is excellent.The USB-C / Thunderbolt connection works excellent for a hub in order to connect to ethernet and an extra monitor, although I don't care for the high location on the side of the computer - if you want to use the Surface standing up with a second monitor, a right-angle cable helps, search on Amazon for "Thunderbolt Cable Right Angle."I tested using my Thunderbolt hub, and the video is fast and solid looking. But my wife uses it just as a tablet and table top computer, so she doesn't need the extra connections.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best laptop I’ve had in years
reviews.reviewText: For a slim laptop running a real OS, the Surface is as close to perfection as one can get.It’s lightweight but not flimsy. The keyboard and touchpad are responsive and feel good to the touch. The screen is gorgeous. The processor is fast, wifi is blazing fast, and the webcam is crystal clear.The only downside, perhaps, is the price — my company bought this for me — otherwise the $2k price tag for the surface + keyboard would have put me off.If you’re using it for work, you really need the keyboard, the machine isn’t really useable for word processing without it.It’s the best laptop I’ve had in a long time. I was a hard-core Apple fan until 2017 when I bought a MacAir with a defective keyboard. I think the combination of having real Windows plus the gorgeous lightweight but robust hardware makes the Surface far better than anything offered by Apple at the moment.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars decent upgrade to an older surface
reviews.reviewText: Bought this to replace my aging surface pro 4. Really liked that one, but the screen had issues and it couldn't cool itself enough anymore.Best new features of this new model: USBC! You can also charge with USBC, even on a very slow charger. Even the usbc port in my outlet was enough (though slow at only 12 watts).Can't give it 5 stars though. The battery life is not great (I have an i5 model). I was really expecting all day battery, but it's more like 4-ish hours or so. I don't know what it's rated for, but i expected more.The keyboard doesn't fit as well up against the screen as my old one. It has a space for a pen, but it won't fit the pen from my older surface. It also covers part of the bottom of the screen.There is no MicroSD slot anymore, which is a bummer. Good news is that the hard drive is replaceable. It would be WAY cheaper to get the smallest hard drive and upgrade with an aftermarket drive. Unfortunately, if you get the smallest drive, you'll also be ram limited. I have an 8GB model, but I really should have upgraded to the 16. 8GB just isn't enough these days.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My life became a looooot easier
reviews.reviewText: Super lightweight. Super practical. Super easy to use. I couldn’t believe that I got rid of my old heavy laptop!!Super fast to start and am easily connected with my PC at the office when am abroad.I surely advise you to buy it especially that it is cheaper from Amazon than the Bahraini market.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good product for people on go - school kids or professionals
reviews.reviewText: Am in software engineering for past decades so know a little bit of computing technology. Personally, was impressed with this product - while buying it for a high school kid. So was looking for a product which is easy to carry, quick to open and stash, easy to work on, has keyboard and screen touch options - something which is a combination of a tablet (or iPad) and a laptop. Surface provides all that. The touch screen is easy to work with which makes it a good tablet option, while at the same time with a keypad it is good to work on as a computer. So, why not iPad - mainly because this is largest screen size (13 inch) in this family of products - and it is not having OS of a mobile device but runs a full MS windows 11 operating system.Good for people who are looking for a handy laptop, with some compromise on screen size.

I'm writing this review using my surface pro right now, while laying on the couch, on a Sunday afternoon.Its so great to have the full capabilities of a standard lap top and conveniently remove the keyboard and go tablet style when I want.Standard microsoft issues with set up, they want you to share way to much personal information as always.The format is so cool, I highly recommend.

Tablet/laptop works great. I needed something lightweight and powerful for when I travel a few months each year and the Surface Pro 9 is exactly what I needed.Added a Microsoft keyboard and it’s now my day to day laptop.
The display is brilliant but the battery life needs to improve
